tasks: Walk around your field and check for weeds, leftover stalks, stones, and any drainage problems.
Decide on where to make bunds and channels.
Start removing all weeds, old cotton stalks, and stones from the field.
Use a hoe or sickle for weeds and stalks; collect stones in a corner.
Burn or compost weeds and stalks to avoid pest carryover.
Plough the field to break up the soil.
Use a tractor or bullock plough to reach about 10–12 cm deep.
Repair or sharpen ploughs and check for any areas that need extra attention.
Plough the field again, crossing the first direction.
This helps break soil clods and mixes in any leftover plant material.
Walk through the field and break up or remove large soil clods for a fine seedbed.
If soil is still hard or cloddy, plough a third time.
Use a leveller or wooden plank to level the field.
This helps water spread evenly and prevents waterlogging.
Start building or repairing bunds (raised soil borders) around the field.
Use a spade or shovel to shape and strengthen bunds.
Finish all bunds and check for gaps or weak spots.
Strong bunds prevent water from escaping during rain.
Mark out where you'll make small channels for water flow.
Good channels help drain excess water and keep the field healthy.
Dig shallow channels between or around plots for irrigation and drainage.
Walk the field to ensure it's clean, level, and ready for the next steps.
Repair any bunds or channels as needed.
Visit a trusted Agri-store and buy certified Narasimha (NA1325) seeds.
Check for the blue certification tag.
At home, sort through seeds and remove any damaged ones.
Mix seeds with carbendazim (2g per kg seed) or Trichoderma/ Pseudomonas (10g per kg seed).
Place seeds in a tub, sprinkle the treatment, and mix well with hands (use gloves).
Spread treated seeds in shade to dry for a few hours.
Do not dry in direct sunlight.
Collect seed drills, markers, ropes, and measuring sticks.
Check that all tools are clean and ready.
Use ropes or markers to draw straight lines for sowing.
Mark spacing: 90 cm between rows and 60 cm between holes (or as per high-density plan).
Double-check seed quality and field readiness.
Assign family members or workers their tasks for the sowing day.
Sow seeds along the marked lines, placing 1–2 seeds per spot.
Complete sowing in the remaining part of the field.
Ensure even depth and coverage for all seeds.
If there's no rain, give a light irrigation to help seeds sprout.
Walk the field and check that all rows are straight and seeds are evenly spaced.
Mix all phosphorus, one-third nitrogen, and one-third potassium into the soil near the seed rows.
Spread 5–10 tons per hectare of well-rotted farmyard manure (FYM) over the field.
Ensure field is clean, seeds are well covered, and no birds or animals disturb the field.
Inspect the field for seedling emergence.
Note any gaps or poor germination spots.
Where seeds did not sprout, re-sow fresh treated seeds.
Look for signs of soil insects or birds damaging seedlings.
If no rain, give a light irrigation to support young seedlings.
Look for any early weeds and remove them by hand.
Ensure no water is standing after irrigation or rain.
Continue monitoring sprouting, pest, and weed status.
Continue monitoring sprouting, pest, and weed status.
If you see jassids or aphids, prepare neem oil or the recommended pesticide spray.
Spray neem oil or stem-apply Monocrotophos (1:4 water) if pests are present.
Observe crop daily for healthy growth and any problems.
Observe crop daily for healthy growth and any problems.
Observe crop daily for healthy growth and any problems.
Observe crop daily for healthy growth and any problems.
Remove weeds by hand or with a mechanical weeder.
Finish weeding in the remaining parts of the field.
If weeds are still a problem, spray Pendimethalin (1 litre/acre).
Closely inspect leaves for jassids, aphids, or whiteflies.
Stem-apply Monocrotophos (1:4 water) at 30 days after sowing.
Irrigate if there is a dry spell.
Apply the next split of nitrogen and potassium at 30 days after sowing.
Apply the next split of nitrogen and potassium at 30 days after sowing.
Continue checking for weeds, pests, and healthy crop growth.
Continue checking for weeds, pests, and healthy crop growth.
Continue checking for weeds, pests, and healthy crop growth.
Continue checking for weeds, pests, and healthy crop growth.

Continue checking for weeds, pests, and healthy crop growth.
Remove weeds by hand or weeder at 45–60 days after sowing.
Apply the next split of nitrogen and potassium at 60 days after sowing.
If plants look weak or during drought, spray 2% urea or DAP, or 1% KNO₃/19:19:19 on leaves.
Stem-apply Flonicamid (1:20 water) at 60 days for sucking pests.
Monitor crop health, pests, and soil moisture.
Monitor crop health, pests, and soil moisture.
